meanings.definition: To give a gift or tip to someone for good luck or as a token of appreciation.
meanings.sent1: She handseling her friend a lucky charm before the big exam.
meanings.sent2: He handseling the waiter a generous tip for the excellent service.
meanings.sent3: The cat handseling a mouse to the owner as a 'gift'.
meanings.sent4: The sun handseling warmth to the earth every morning.
meanings.sent5: The kind gesture of handseling a flower brightened her day.

meanings.definition: The act of inaugurating or celebrating something, such as a new venture or business.
meanings.sent1: The handseling of the new store brought excitement to the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The handseling of the festival included a ribbon-cutting ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The handseling of the birthday cake was a joyous occasion.
meanings.sent4: The handseling of the ship marked the beginning of its journey.
meanings.sent5: The handseling of the award ceremony was a grand event.

meanings.definition: A ceremony or ritual involving the exchange of gifts or money for good luck or prosperity.
meanings.sent1: The handseling at the temple involved offerings of fruits and flowers.
meanings.sent2: The handseling at the wedding included the exchange of rings.
meanings.sent3: The handseling at the office party was filled with laughter and joy.
meanings.sent4: The handseling at the harvest festival symbolized abundance and blessings.
meanings.sent5: The handseling at the charity event raised funds for a good cause.
